question: 節々
sourceMnemonic: Your <kanji>joint</kanji> <kanji>joint</kanji>s are your <vocabulary>various joints</vocabulary>, or even <vocabulary>every joint</vocabulary> in your body, or a specific body part. When we're not talking about the joints in your body, this means something like <vocabulary>various parts</vocabulary>, referring to various parts of a whole.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is just the kun'yomi of <ja>節</ja>, which you learned with <ja>節目</ja>, repeated twice. Keep in mind that the second <ja>ふし</ja> gets rendaku'd to <ja>ぶし</ja>!
